p: Sesquiterpenes, diterpenes and flavonoids, closely related to those observed in the ethyl acetate extracts of L. radula and L. paniculata, were also identified in other Lepechinia spp., together with pentacyclic triterpenes and other metabolites. L. speciosa [ 39], L. caulescens [ 40, 41], L. meyeni [ 42], L. hastata [ 42], L. chamaedryoides [ 43], L. bullata [ 12, 44] and L. graveolens [ 8] were particularly relevant for the presence of daucane sesquiterpenes and abietanic diterpenes. In particular, terpenes such as spathulenol, carnosic acid, carnosol and spirolepechinene, or flavonoids such as pinocembrin, 5-hydroxy-4â€²,7-dimethoxyflavone and luteolin-7-O-glucuronide were obtained and purified from these species.
